reviews_with_mentions:
• Directly across the street from Hilton Checkers Los Angeles. Nice neighborhood find. Great wine selection. Easy to conduct a business meeting, eat dinner and enjoy some wine. Excellent service provided.
  • First, the caveat. I came here for a late business lunch (1:30) and we were a bit time constrained. This impacted the ambiance, noise level, and possibly a tad the service, but NOT the food. The Good: the food here is phenomenal. The constantly changing menu has a number of things that you've likely never even HEARD of, let alone had. The oyster selection is also likely the best in LA. Even the portions were relatively large for a place like this. Try the Clam Chowder, it'll surprise you. The Bad: Very few bad's here.. the bread was relatively blah and the place was dead, but i'm stretching on finding any negatives. Overall: Probably the best traditional seafood restaurant in LA.
  • the staff couldn't have been more accommodating...a good business lunch spot
  • I scheduled a business lunch at the Water Grill. The food was amazing and the service was excellent.
